high_concept: Militarized compliance syndicate of drones, pylons, bureaucrats, and enforcers that weaponize law, logistics, and overwhelming fire control. Space cops gone corporate, obsessed with order, risk mitigation, and making examples.

setting_types.description: Environments, jurisdictions, and controlled zones where NARC forces operate or project power. Use these as backdrops for art, missions, and new unit concepts.

categories.name: Orbital Enforcement Grid
categories.description: A lattice of weapons platforms, surveillance nodes, and orbital strike relays. Home of assets like Narcstar, long-range probes, and targeting infrastructure.

categories.name: Corporate Arcology Precincts
categories.description: Stacked corporate cities with internal laws, armored hallways, checkpoint choke points, and dedicated NARC precincts for internal ‘risk management’.

categories.name: Detention & Processing Facilities
categories.description: Labyrinthine prisons and intake centers where Detainment Probes, Killjoys, and MediFux units work hand-in-hand to break, heal, and reclassify detainees.

categories.name: Border Lockdown Zones
categories.description: Heavily patrolled perimeters bristling with Sentry Nodes, Shield Pylons, and mobile artillery, built to delay, isolate, and neutralize incoming threats.

categories.name: Compliance & Taxation Hubs
categories.description: Administrative complexes where Compliance Auditons, Tax Mistrexes, and legal automatons convert bureaucracy into a form of battlefield control.

categories.name: Urban Suppression Sectors
categories.description: Densely built city blocks repeatedly ‘pacified’ with drones, K-9.0 units, Hover Shields, and Nob Lobbers coordinated through Target Markers.

categories.name: Logistics & Staging Yards
categories.description: Vehicle bays, ammo dumps, and launch platforms where Marine Marauders, Sausage Droids, and Impact Simulants cycle through drills and live exercises.

tone.description: NARC units should feel like over-the-top space cops and corporate enforcers: aggressive, smug, and procedurally cruel. There’s dark humor in how seriously they take minor infractions, but they remain genuinely dangerous and over-armed.

silhouette.description: Hard-edged, utilitarian shapes that read as security hardware, armored troopers, or defensive infrastructure at a glance.
rules: Favor geometric, angular silhouettes: rectangles, towers, turrets, shields, and drones.
Make weaponry and protective elements (shields, armor plates, pylons) visually dominant.
Keep silhouettes clean and modular, as if mass-produced and standardized across jurisdictions.
Base colors should lean toward gunmetal, navy, gray, and off-white.
Use bright accents sparingly for lights, visors, warning stripes, and insignia.
Visual language should suggest ‘official’ hardware: stripes, chevrons, serial markings.

categories.enforcers: Armored bipedal units like Bruut Enforcer or Marine Marauder, with heavy weapons and visible tactical gear.
categories.drones: Floating or skittering machines such as K-9.0, Detainment Probes, and Target Markers, designed for surveillance, tagging, or disabling.
categories.infrastructure: Static or semi-mobile defenses like Shield Pylons, Hover Shields, Sentry Nodes: hard shapes, emitters, and field projectors.
categories.command: Named leaders or specialists such as Lokar Simmons or Narcstar: cleaner silhouettes, more ornate badges, and distinct visual authority.
categories.support_medical: Clinical but sinister units like MediFux-1NDS that ‘heal’ and ‘treat’ in ways that feel more like maintenance than compassion.

guidelines: Names should evoke policing, compliance, taxation, or military jargon twisted into something slightly absurd.
Prefer short, punchy constructions (1–3 words) that sound like codenames or product SKUs.
It’s fine to be darkly humorous, but units should still feel like they could ruin your day in a firefight.

mechanical_identity.secondary_resource_notes: gear is often used to represent advanced hardware, munitions, and medical or targeting tech; meat appears sparsely for hybrid marines or biological costs.

special_flags_usage.biological: Used sparingly for human or near-human operatives such as officers and marines (e.g., Lokar Simmons, Marine Marauder). Often indicates vulnerability to certain effects but compatibility with ‘medical’ support.
special_flags_usage.mechanical: Default for enforcement drones, pylons, targeting units, and armored constructs. Represents standard-issue NARC hardware and most rank-and-file goons.
special_flags_usage.resist: Assigned to hardened enforcers, shielded constructs, and key leaders (Bruut Enforcer, Buzzkill, Killjoy). Evokes heavier armor, redundancy, or reinforced compliance protocols.
special_flags_usage.no_unwind: Used on infrastructure-like units or fully committed assets (Lurker, Shield Pylon, Hover Shield) that are always ‘on duty’ and compensate with static, powerful defensive or retaliatory effects.
